text:
I have tried the following configurations:
1) alias /scmsgs "c:/msg_base/"
2) alias /scmsgs "c:/msg_base"
3) alias /scmsgs c:/msg_base/
4) alias /scmsgs c:/msg_base
5) alias /scmsgs/ "c:/msg_base/"
6) alias /scmsgs/ "c:/msg_base"
7) alias /scmsgs/ c:/msg_base/
8) alias /scmsgs/ c:/msg_base

The offending line of code with all of the above tried is as follows:

<a href="/scmsgs/member_inbox.php"

I believe this to be a bug. I searched the data base, and found someone to have experienced an error 404, but not 403. Has this bug been fixed in subsequent updates?

Thanx in advance.

Q.
creator: sigung_q@yahoo.com

text: Bugzilla is for reporting bugs in the server, not for user support.
creator: covener@gmail.com
sigung_q@yahoo.com
text: I am aware of that Eric. As stated, I believe this to be a bug, and I'm asking if it has been fixed.
